channel.title: Database on Dash's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Database on Dash's Blog

item.title: Transaction and Concurrency Control
item.description: Transaction Definition Transaction: A sequence of multiple actions to be executed as an atomic unit. Transaction in SQL view: Begin transaction Sequence of SQL statements End transaction Transaction Manager controls excution of transactions. Program logic is invisible to DBMS. For example: 1. start transaction 2. read(R) 3. R = R - 100 ------> Invisible 4. write(R) 5. read(S) 6. S = S + 100 ------> Invisible 7. write(S) 8.

item.title: Use Oracle on Docker for Windows
item.description: Environment version WSL 2 Docker Engine v19.03.13 Oracle Database Enterprise 12.2.0.1 Install WLS2 Check detailed and official document here. Problems I encountered 1. Use any commands related to WSL2 will cause error： “The attempted operation is not supported for the type of object referenced.” This is beacause the proxy software conflicts with the sock port of WSL2.
